channel.title: 317 delta gold coin bug
channel.description:
Hey everyone. I'm new to coding so I figured I should start off with a stable base like Delta.
The source is good and everything but when I buy something from the store, it doesn't take my gold.
For example. If I had 100k and dragon scim is 80k. I will buy it, but it doesn't delete the gold from my inventory. I do not know where to start! Please Help!

item.title: 317 delta gold coin bug
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:551945”][quote author=matzie link=topic=670861.msg4486232#msg4486232 date=1434116906]

Starting at where the shop code is would probably be a good idea.

lol

Can you buy 2 of them with 100k? If yes, it does not delete the coins. If no, it just is not updating your client.
[/quote]
Where was the logic in that?
Just because he can’t buy two doesn’t mean the client is not updating…
It really depends on how his code is setup.
Lets say the owner before him just commented out the delete code for coins. That would mean I could buy a full inventory of dragon scimitars with only having 80k, as it never deletes.
And, if the code was anything like what PI had in the shop system (They used a for loop to add each individual item you bought), you could buy an inventory with one click because each time it looped it’d still see you had 80k.

Also, if the scimitar shows up in inventory and the coins don’t delete, the client is clearly updating.

So, yes OP, as Zymus said… You need to start with your shop code. Take a look at the buying method.[/quote]
I said buy “2” and there is no button for that. My logic was buy 1, twice.

if (BALANCE > COUNT) { //delete coins //tell client the new count }
if delete coins does not exist, the BALANCE will still have enough to buy a second one.
if the client update does not exist, the BALANCE will have been modified, but your actual BALANCE was decreased correctly.

It most likely is the case that the code was commented out for delete coins. That being because there are so many PVP servers. delta has a decent combat base(not perfect, but a type of base people play) so they may have used it for that. I cannot see a reason that someone would comment out the update code, unless they did both.

Read full topic

lol

Can you buy 2 of them with 100k? If yes, it does not delete the coins. If no, it just is not updating your client.[/quote]
Where was the logic in that?
Just because he can’t buy two doesn’t mean the client is not updating…
It really depends on how his code is setup.
Lets say the owner before him just commented out the delete code for coins. That would mean I could buy a full inventory of dragon scimitars with only having 80k, as it never deletes.
And, if the code was anything like what PI had in the shop system (They used a for loop to add each individual item you bought), you could buy an inventory with one click because each time it looped it’d still see you had 80k.

Also, if the scimitar shows up in inventory and the coins don’t delete, the client is clearly updating.

So, yes OP, as Zymus said… You need to start with your shop code. Take a look at the buying method.
